newsitem.title: GERMANY: German DAX posts biggest one-day loss this year.
newsitem.headline: German DAX posts biggest one-day loss this year.

text.p: 1241 GMT - Germany's 30-share DAX ends bourse trade at its biggest one-day loss since last December and one of the 10 biggest losses in its history, after Wall Street's slide on Monday. Market now looking to U.S. NAPM data due at 1500 GMT.
* DAX index closes floor trade down 133.12 points, or 3.88 percent, at 3,295.93 points. But index holds support at 3,280 points after brief slide below.
* June DTB DAX futures down 121.5 at 3,302.5.
* Shares weaker across the board. Deutsche underperforms as ABN AMRO cuts from hold to sell.
* Next major DAX technical support at 3,080 points.
